content: Do experts generally consider undefined behavior a security bug? I do because it opens the possibility for any misbehavior in the future, but I wonder if that is a consensus view.
Personally I think it depends on the issue. In general I think something like that is the consensus though.
Depends on the exact case. The RustSec policy is "if in doubt, surface it as a warning".
yeah, we made a whole separate unsound categorization of informational (as opposed to security/vulnerability) advisories for this purpose
